table.name: aminoacid_variant
table.remarks: The Aminoacid Variant table contains subsequences of proteins (i.e., only of a subset of all annotations) that differ from the reference amino acid sequence of the virus species.

column.name: sequence_aa_original
column.remarks: Affected amino acid sequence from the corresponding reference sequence of the chosen Virus

column.name: sequence_aa_alternative
column.remarks: Changed amino acid sequence (in the target sequence) with respect to the reference one

column.name: start_aa_original
column.remarks: Coordinate where the change starts on the reference sequrence

column.name: variant_aa_length
column.remarks: Length of amino acid change in units of impacted residues

column.name: variant_aa_type
column.remarks: Type of amino acid change (SUB = substitution, INS = insertion, DEL = deletion)

table.name: annotation
table.remarks: Annotations include a number of subsequences representing segments (with their coordinates) of the original sequence with a particular type.

column.name: feature_type
column.remarks: The annotation type of the observed sub-sequence (e.g., gene, peptide, coding DNA region, or untranslated region, molecule patterns such as stem loops and so on)

column.name: start
column.remarks: Start coordinate of annotation on reference sequence

column.name: stop
column.remarks: Stop coordinate of annotation on reference sequence

column.name: gene_name
column.remarks: Gene to which the sub-sequence belongs

column.name: product
column.remarks: Protein produced by the sub-sequence within which the amino acid change occurs

column.name: external_reference
column.remarks: Eventually related external reference (when the protein is present in a separate database such as UniProtKB)

table.name: annotation_sequence
table.remarks: The table holds sequences related to the specific annotation.

table.name: epitope
table.remarks: The Epitope table describes the epitopes extracted from IEDB.

column.name: epitope_iri
column.remarks: Identifies the single epitope within the IEDB system (ID) and allows to resort to its information

column.name: iedb_epitope_id
column.remarks: Identifies the single epitope within the IEDB system (IRI) and allows to resort to its information

column.name: cell_type
column.remarks: Indicates the target of the experiment (allowing values are 'T cell', 'B cell', 'MHC ligand')

column.name: mhc_class
column.remarks: Indicates the general classes of alleles provided in the previous field (possible values are 'I', 'II', or 'I,II' if both class I and II alleles are considered)

column.name: response_frequency_pos
column.remarks: On IEDB this measure is defined as the number of positively responded subjects (R) divided by the total number of those tested (N), summed up by mapped epitopes; however, to compensate for epitopes that are identified by a low number of assays, we employ a corrected formula (proposed in Carrasco et al., 2015), where the importance of corrections decreases as the number of assays increases.

column.name: epitope_sequence
column.remarks: Indicates the general classes of alleles provided in the previous field (possible values are 'I', 'II', or 'I,II' if both class I and II alleles are considered).

column.name: epi_annotation_start
column.remarks: Start coordinate of epitope on protein

column.name: epi_annotation_stop
column.remarks: Stop coordinate of epitope on protein

column.name: external_link
column.remarks: References the publication where the epitope was first reported (and manually collected by IEDB curation team).

column.name: prediction_process
column.remarks: Prediction process used for the epitope (now they are all imported from IEDB)

column.name: is_linear
column.remarks: Defines continuous (true) or discontinuous (false) epitopes, composed of amino acid residues that may be located on different protein regions -- brought together by protein folding

column.name: mhc_allele
column.remarks: Also referred to as 'mhc_allele', it indicates the list of the class (e.g., 'HLA Class I'), or lists of alleles (e.g., 'HLA-B\*35:01, HLA-B\*15:01') to which the epitope is restricted-this is relevant only for T-cell and MHC Ligand assays

column.name: assay_type
column.remarks: Indicates the outcome - considering possibly multiple experiments (we have 'positive', 'negative', and 'both', when positive and negative outcomes were included)

table.name: epitope_2697049_e_envelope_
table.viewSql: SELECT DISTINCT epi.iedb_epitope_id, epi.epitope_iri, epi.cell_type, epi.mhc_class, epi.mhc_allele, epi.response_frequency_pos, epi.epi_annotation_start, epi.epi_annotation_stop, epi.is_linear, epi.assay_type, epif.epi_fragment_sequence, epif.epi_frag_annotation_start, epif.epi_frag_annotation_stop, vir.taxon_id, vir.taxon_name, hspec.host_taxon_id, hspec.host_taxon_name, seq.sequence_id, ann.product, amin.aminoacid_variant_id, amin.start_aa_original, amin.sequence_aa_original, amin.sequence_aa_alternative, amin.variant_aa_length, amin.variant_aa_type FROM (((((((epitope epi JOIN epitope_fragment epif ON ((epi.epitope_id = epif.epitope_id))) JOIN virus vir ON ((epi.virus_id = vir.virus_id))) JOIN host_specie hspec ON ((epi.host_id = hspec.host_id))) JOIN host_sample hsamp ON ((hspec.host_id = hsamp.host_id))) JOIN sequence seq ON (((hsamp.host_sample_id = seq.host_sample_id) AND (vir.virus_id = seq.virus_id)))) JOIN annotation ann ON ((seq.sequence_id = ann.sequence_id))) JOIN aminoacid_variant amin ON ((ann.annotation_id = amin.annotation_id))) WHERE (((epi.protein_name)::text = (ann.product)::text) AND (amin.start_aa_original <= epif.epi_frag_annotation_stop) AND (amin.start_aa_original >= epif.epi_frag_annotation_start) AND ((ann.product)::text = 'E (envelope protein)'::text) AND ((epi.protein_name)::text = 'E (envelope protein)'::text) AND (vir.taxon_id = 2697049)) ORDER BY epi.iedb_epitope_id;

table.name: epitope_2697049_m_membrane_
table.viewSql: SELECT DISTINCT epi.iedb_epitope_id, epi.epitope_iri, epi.cell_type, epi.mhc_class, epi.mhc_allele, epi.response_frequency_pos, epi.epi_annotation_start, epi.epi_annotation_stop, epi.is_linear, epi.assay_type, epif.epi_fragment_sequence, epif.epi_frag_annotation_start, epif.epi_frag_annotation_stop, vir.taxon_id, vir.taxon_name, hspec.host_taxon_id, hspec.host_taxon_name, seq.sequence_id, ann.product, amin.aminoacid_variant_id, amin.start_aa_original, amin.sequence_aa_original, amin.sequence_aa_alternative, amin.variant_aa_length, amin.variant_aa_type FROM (((((((epitope epi JOIN epitope_fragment epif ON ((epi.epitope_id = epif.epitope_id))) JOIN virus vir ON ((epi.virus_id = vir.virus_id))) JOIN host_specie hspec ON ((epi.host_id = hspec.host_id))) JOIN host_sample hsamp ON ((hspec.host_id = hsamp.host_id))) JOIN sequence seq ON (((hsamp.host_sample_id = seq.host_sample_id) AND (vir.virus_id = seq.virus_id)))) JOIN annotation ann ON ((seq.sequence_id = ann.sequence_id))) JOIN aminoacid_variant amin ON ((ann.annotation_id = amin.annotation_id))) WHERE (((epi.protein_name)::text = (ann.product)::text) AND (amin.start_aa_original <= epif.epi_frag_annotation_stop) AND (amin.start_aa_original >= epif.epi_frag_annotation_start) AND ((ann.product)::text = 'M (membrane glycoprotein)'::text) AND ((epi.protein_name)::text = 'M (membrane glycoprotein)'::text) AND (vir.taxon_id = 2697049)) ORDER BY epi.iedb_epitope_id;

table.name: epitope_2697049_nsp11
table.viewSql: SELECT DISTINCT epi.iedb_epitope_id, epi.epitope_iri, epi.cell_type, epi.mhc_class, epi.mhc_allele, epi.response_frequency_pos, epi.epi_annotation_start, epi.epi_annotation_stop, epi.is_linear, epi.assay_type, epif.epi_fragment_sequence, epif.epi_frag_annotation_start, epif.epi_frag_annotation_stop, vir.taxon_id, vir.taxon_name, hspec.host_taxon_id, hspec.host_taxon_name, seq.sequence_id, ann.product, amin.aminoacid_variant_id, amin.start_aa_original, amin.sequence_aa_original, amin.sequence_aa_alternative, amin.variant_aa_length, amin.variant_aa_type FROM (((((((epitope epi JOIN epitope_fragment epif ON ((epi.epitope_id = epif.epitope_id))) JOIN virus vir ON ((epi.virus_id = vir.virus_id))) JOIN host_specie hspec ON ((epi.host_id = hspec.host_id))) JOIN host_sample hsamp ON ((hspec.host_id = hsamp.host_id))) JOIN sequence seq ON (((hsamp.host_sample_id = seq.host_sample_id) AND (vir.virus_id = seq.virus_id)))) JOIN annotation ann ON ((seq.sequence_id = ann.sequence_id))) JOIN aminoacid_variant amin ON ((ann.annotation_id = amin.annotation_id))) WHERE (((epi.protein_name)::text = (ann.product)::text) AND (amin.start_aa_original <= epif.epi_frag_annotation_stop) AND (amin.start_aa_original >= epif.epi_frag_annotation_start) AND ((ann.product)::text = 'NSP11'::text) AND ((epi.protein_name)::text = 'NSP11'::text) AND (vir.taxon_id = 2697049)) ORDER BY epi.iedb_epitope_id;

table.name: epitope_2697049_nsp14_3_to_
table.viewSql: SELECT DISTINCT epi.iedb_epitope_id, epi.epitope_iri, epi.cell_type, epi.mhc_class, epi.mhc_allele, epi.response_frequency_pos, epi.epi_annotation_start, epi.epi_annotation_stop, epi.is_linear, epi.assay_type, epif.epi_fragment_sequence, epif.epi_frag_annotation_start, epif.epi_frag_annotation_stop, vir.taxon_id, vir.taxon_name, hspec.host_taxon_id, hspec.host_taxon_name, seq.sequence_id, ann.product, amin.aminoacid_variant_id, amin.start_aa_original, amin.sequence_aa_original, amin.sequence_aa_alternative, amin.variant_aa_length, amin.variant_aa_type FROM (((((((epitope epi JOIN epitope_fragment epif ON ((epi.epitope_id = epif.epitope_id))) JOIN virus vir ON ((epi.virus_id = vir.virus_id))) JOIN host_specie hspec ON ((epi.host_id = hspec.host_id))) JOIN host_sample hsamp ON ((hspec.host_id = hsamp.host_id))) JOIN sequence seq ON (((hsamp.host_sample_id = seq.host_sample_id) AND (vir.virus_id = seq.virus_id)))) JOIN annotation ann ON ((seq.sequence_id = ann.sequence_id))) JOIN aminoacid_variant amin ON ((ann.annotation_id = amin.annotation_id))) WHERE (((epi.protein_name)::text = (ann.product)::text) AND (amin.start_aa_original <= epif.epi_frag_annotation_stop) AND (amin.start_aa_original >= epif.epi_frag_annotation_start) AND ((ann.product)::text = 'NSP14 (3''-to-5'' exonuclease)'::text) AND ((epi.protein_name)::text = 'NSP14 (3''-to-5'' exonuclease)'::text) AND (vir.taxon_id = 2697049)) ORDER BY epi.iedb_epitope_id;

table.name: epitope_2697049_nsp15_endor

table.viewSql: SELECT DISTINCT epi.iedb_epitope_id, epi.epitope_iri, epi.cell_type, epi.mhc_class, epi.mhc_allele, epi.response_frequency_pos, epi.epi_annotation_start, epi.epi_annotation_stop, epi.is_linear, epi.assay_type, epif.epi_fragment_sequence, epif.epi_frag_annotation_start, epif.epi_frag_annotation_stop, vir.taxon_id, vir.taxon_name, hspec.host_taxon_id, hspec.host_taxon_name, seq.sequence_id, ann.product, amin.aminoacid_variant_id, amin.start_aa_original, amin.sequence_aa_original, amin.sequence_aa_alternative, amin.variant_aa_length, amin.variant_aa_type FROM (((((((epitope epi JOIN epitope_fragment epif ON ((epi.epitope_id = epif.epitope_id))) JOIN virus vir ON ((epi.virus_id = vir.virus_id))) JOIN host_specie hspec ON ((epi.host_id = hspec.host_id))) JOIN host_sample hsamp ON ((hspec.host_id = hsamp.host_id))) JOIN sequence seq ON (((hsamp.host_sample_id = seq.host_sample_id) AND (vir.virus_id = seq.virus_id)))) JOIN annotation ann ON ((seq.sequence_id = ann.sequence_id))) JOIN aminoacid_variant amin ON ((ann.annotation_id = amin.annotation_id))) WHERE (((epi.protein_name)::text = (ann.product)::text) AND (amin.start_aa_original <= epif.epi_frag_annotation_stop) AND (amin.start_aa_original >= epif.epi_frag_annotation_start) AND ((ann.product)::text = 'ORF1ab polyprotein'::text) AND ((epi.protein_name)::text = 'ORF1ab polyprotein'::text) AND (vir.taxon_id = 2697049)) ORDER BY epi.iedb_epitope_id;

table.name: epitope_2697049_spike_surfa
table.viewSql: SELECT DISTINCT epi.iedb_epitope_id, epi.epitope_iri, epi.cell_type, epi.mhc_class, epi.mhc_allele, epi.response_frequency_pos, epi.epi_annotation_start, epi.epi_annotation_stop, epi.is_linear, epi.assay_type, epif.epi_fragment_sequence, epif.epi_frag_annotation_start, epif.epi_frag_annotation_stop, vir.taxon_id, vir.taxon_name, hspec.host_taxon_id, hspec.host_taxon_name, seq.sequence_id, ann.product, amin.aminoacid_variant_id, amin.start_aa_original, amin.sequence_aa_original, amin.sequence_aa_alternative, amin.variant_aa_length, amin.variant_aa_type FROM (((((((epitope epi JOIN epitope_fragment epif ON ((epi.epitope_id = epif.epitope_id))) JOIN virus vir ON ((epi.virus_id = vir.virus_id))) JOIN host_specie hspec ON ((epi.host_id = hspec.host_id))) JOIN host_sample hsamp ON ((hspec.host_id = hsamp.host_id))) JOIN sequence seq ON (((hsamp.host_sample_id = seq.host_sample_id) AND (vir.virus_id = seq.virus_id)))) JOIN annotation ann ON ((seq.sequence_id = ann.sequence_id))) JOIN aminoacid_variant amin ON ((ann.annotation_id = amin.annotation_id))) WHERE (((epi.protein_name)::text = (ann.product)::text) AND (amin.start_aa_original <= epif.epi_frag_annotation_stop) AND (amin.start_aa_original >= epif.epi_frag_annotation_start) AND ((ann.product)::text = 'Spike (surface glycoprotein)'::text) AND ((epi.protein_name)::text = 'Spike (surface glycoprotein)'::text) AND (vir.taxon_id = 2697049)) ORDER BY epi.iedb_epitope_id;

table.name: epitope_fragment
table.remarks: The EpitopeFragment table contains the segments of non linear epitopes (each of which is contained within one comprehensive epitope).

column.name: epi_fragment_sequence
column.remarks: Sequence of epitope fragment (of non-linear epitope) in amino acid residues

column.name: epi_frag_annotation_start
column.remarks: Start coordinate of fragment

column.name: epi_frag_annotation_stop
column.remarks: Stop coordinate of fragment

table.name: experiment_type
table.remarks: Sequences are derived from one experiment of a given type (described in the Experiment Type table) performed to analyse the biological material.

column.name: sequencing_technology
column.remarks: Platform used for the sequencing experiment

column.name: assembly_method
column.remarks: Algorithms applied to obtain the final sequence (e.g., for reads assembly, reads alignment, variant calling)

column.name: coverage
column.remarks: Number of unique reads that include a specific nucleotide in the reconstructed sequence

table.name: host_sample
table.remarks: An assay is performed on a tissue extracted from an organism that has hosted the virus for an amount of time; this information is collected in the HostSample table.

column.name: collection_date
column.remarks: Date in which the infected biological sample was collected

column.name: isolation_source
column.remarks: Tissue from which the infected biological sample was collected

column.name: originating_lab
column.remarks: Laboratory where the biological material was first sampled

column.name: country
column.remarks: Second-level geographical characterization of location where the biological sample was collected (e.g., country)

column.name: region
column.remarks: Third-level geographical characterization of location where the biological sample was collected (e.g., region or US states)

column.name: geo_group
column.remarks: First-level geographical characterization of location where the biological sample was collected (e.g., continent)

column.name: age
column.remarks: Host organism age (in years, when applicable)

column.name: gender
column.remarks: Host organism gender (when applicable)

column.name: province
column.remarks: Fourth-level geographical characterization of location where the biological sample was collected (e.g., province or US county)

column.name: coll_date_precision
column.remarks: Precision of the collection date derived from the data source (0 = only year available; 1 = also month available; 2 = also day available)

table.name: host_sample_view
table.viewSql: SELECT host_sample.host_sample_id, host_sample.host_id, host_sample.collection_date, host_sample.isolation_source, host_sample.originating_lab, host_sample.country, host_sample.region, host_sample.geo_group, host_sample.age, host_sample.gender, host_specie.host_taxon_id, host_specie.host_taxon_name FROM (host_sample JOIN host_specie USING (host_id));

table.name: host_specie
table.remarks: The HostSpecie table represents the identification of the animal species both involved in the extraction of biological material to be sequenced and in the epitope design.

column.name: host_taxon_id
column.remarks: Host organism species ID from NCBI Taxonomy https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy

column.name: host_taxon_name
column.remarks: Host organism species name from NCBI Taxonomy https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy

table.name: nucleotide_sequence
table.remarks: The table holds string sequences related to the fulls sequence record.

column.name: nucleotide_sequence
column.remarks: String of nucleotides representing the full consensus sequence

table.name: nucleotide_variant
table.remarks: The Nucleotide Variant table contains subsequences of the main sequence that differ from the reference sequence of the same virus species.

column.name: sequence_original
column.remarks: Affected nucleotide sequence from the corresponding reference sequence of the chosen Virus

column.name: sequence_alternative
column.remarks: Changed ucleotide sequence (in the target sequence) with respect to the reference one

column.name: start_original
column.remarks: Coordinate where the mutation starts on the reference sequrence

column.name: start_alternative
column.remarks: Coordinate where the mutation starts on the target sequrence

column.name: variant_length
column.remarks: Length of mutation in units of impacted nucleotides

column.name: variant_type
column.remarks: Type of nucleotide mutation (SUB = substitution, INS = insertion, DEL = deletion)

table.name: nucleotide_variant_annotated
table.viewSql: SELECT nc.nucleotide_variant_id, nc.sequence_id, nc.variant_type, nc.start_original, CASE nc.variant_type WHEN 'SUB'::text THEN nc.sequence_original ELSE NULL::character varying END AS sequence_original, CASE nc.variant_type WHEN 'SUB'::text THEN nc.sequence_alternative ELSE NULL::character varying END AS sequence_alternative, nc.variant_length, ann.gene_name AS n_gene_name FROM (nucleotide_variant nc LEFT JOIN annotation ann ON (((nc.start_original >= ann.start) AND (nc.start_original <= ann.stop) AND (nc.sequence_id = ann.sequence_id) AND ((ann.feature_type)::text = 'gene'::text))));

table.name: sequence
table.remarks: The Sequence table represents a viral sequence of either DNA or RNA. In both cases, sequences are composed of nucleotides (A, C, G, T).

column.name: accession_id
column.remarks: Sequence identifier as extracted from the data source

column.name: alternative_accession_id
column.remarks: Sequence alternative identifier as extracted from the original data source or another one

column.name: strain_name
column.remarks: Name of strain of the sequence

column.name: is_reference
column.remarks: True when the sequence is the reference one (from RefSeq) for the virus species, False when the sequence is not the reference one

column.name: is_complete
column.remarks: True when the sequence is complete, False when the sequence is partial. When not available from original source, we set False if its length is less than 95% of the reference sequence length, otherwise we set N/D since completeness cannot be determined with needed accuracy.

column.name: strand
column.remarks: Strand to which the sequence belongs to (either positive or negative)

column.name: length
column.remarks: Number of nucleotides of the sequence

column.name: gc_percentage
column.remarks: Percentage of read G and C bases

column.name: n_percentage
column.remarks: Percentage of unknown bases

column.name: lineage
column.remarks: Sequence lineage derived from source (for COG-UK) or calculated with the Pangolin software https://cov-lineages.org/pangolin.html (for other sources)

column.name: clade
column.remarks: Clade as computed by GISAID (when available)

column.name: gisaid_only
column.remarks: True if sequence is only available via GISAID, False if available also in GenBank or COG-UK

table.name: sequencing_project
table.remarks: The Sequencing Project table represents a project in which a particular sequencing activity is carried out.

column.name: sequencing_lab
column.remarks: Laboratory that sequenced and submitted the sequence to the databank (encoded by 'Database source')

column.name: submission_date
column.remarks: Date of submission of the sequence to the databank (encoded by 'Database source')

column.name: database_source
column.remarks: Original database from which information is collected

column.name: bioproject_id
column.remarks: External reference to the NCBI BioProject database https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/bioproject/

table.name: variant_impact
table.remarks: We annotate each variant with its predicted impact (using SnpEff).

column.name: effect
column.remarks: Effect of nucleotide variant as computed by SnpEff

column.name: putative_impact
column.remarks: Putative impact of nucleotide variant as computed by SnpEff

column.name: impact_gene_name
column.remarks: Genes impacted by nucleotide variant as computed by SnpEff

table.name: virus
table.remarks: The Virus table describes the viruses to which sequences belong; they are described by a complex taxonomy.

column.name: taxon_id
column.remarks: Virus numerical id as to the NCBI Taxonomy https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy

column.name: taxon_name
column.remarks: Virus name as to the NCBI Taxonomy https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy

column.name: family
column.remarks: Virus family as to the NCBI Taxonomy https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy

column.name: sub_family
column.remarks: Virus sub-family as to the NCBI Taxonomy https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy

column.name: genus
column.remarks: Virus genus as to the NCBI Taxonomy https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy

column.name: species
column.remarks: Virus species as to the NCBI Taxonomy https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy

column.name: equivalent_list
column.remarks: Alternative terminology for virus name as to the NCBI Taxonomy https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy

column.name: molecule_type
column.remarks: A virus species corresponds to a specific Molecule Type (e.g., genomic RNA, viral cRNA, unassigned DNA)

column.name: is_single_stranded
column.remarks: The molecule type has either double or single-stranded structure (TRUE = single; FALSE = double)

column.name: is_positive_stranded
column.remarks: The strand is either positive or negative (TRUE = positive; FALSE = negative)
